net.sf.click.extras.cayenne
Class CayenneForm

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.click.control.Form
      net.sf.click.extras.cayenne.CayenneForm
All Implemented Interfaces:
Control, Serializable
public class CayenneForm
extends Form

Provides Cayenne data aware Form control:   <form method='POST'>.

*
 
Cayenne is an Object Relational Mapping (ORM) framework. The CayenneForm supports creating (inserting) and saving (updating) Cayenne DataObject instances. This form will automatically apply the given data objects validation constraints to the form fields.

The CayenneForm uses the thread local DataContext obtained via DataContext.getThreadDataContext() for all object for persistence operations.

The example below provides a Department data object creation and editing page. To edit an existing department object, the object is passed to the page as a request parameter. Otherwise a new department object will be created when saveChanges() is called. 

 public class DepartmentEdit extends Page {

   private CayenneForm form = new CayenneForm("form", Department.class);

    public DepartmentEdit() {
        form.add(new TextField("name", "Department Name", 35);
        form.add(new TextArea("description", "Description", 35, 2);

        form.add(new Submit("ok", "   OK   ", this, "onOkClicked");
        form.add(new Submit("cancel", this, "onCancelClicked");

        form.setButtonAlign("right");
        addControl(form);
    }

    public void onGet() {
        Department department = (Department)
           getContext().getRequestAttribute("department");

        if (department != null) {
            form.setDataObject(department);
        }
    }

    public boolean onOkClicked() {
        if (form.isValid()) {
           if (form.saveChanges()) {
               setRedirect("departments-view.htm");
           }
        }
        return true;
    }

    public boolean onCancelClicked() {
        setRedirect("departments-view.htm");
        return false;
    }
 }

Author:
Andrus Adamchik, Malcolm Edgar

getDataContext

public DataContext getDataContext()

Returns:

getDataObject

public DataObject getDataObject()
Return a DataObject from the form with the form field values copied into the data object's properties.

Returns:
the data object from the form with the form field values applied to the data object properties.

setDataObject

public void setDataObject(DataObject dataObject)
Set the given DataObject in the form, copying the object's properties into the form field values. This method will also set the relationship selection.

Parameters:
dataObject - the DataObject to set

addRelation

public void addRelation(String propertyName,
                        Class dataClass,
                        Field propertyField)
Adds and registers a new property relationship with the given property name, foreign DataObject class and property field.

Parameters:
propertyName - the form's data object relationship property name
dataClass - the relationship foreign DataObject class
propertyField - the property field for the relationship

saveChanges

public boolean saveChanges()
Save the object to the database committing all changes in the DataContext and return true. If a ValidationException occured then all DataContext changes will be rolled back, the valiation error will be set as the Form's error and the method will return false.

If no DataObject is added to the form using setDataObject() then this method will:

  • create and register a new object instance with the DataContext
  • copy the form's field values to the objects properties
  • insert a new object record in the database

If an existing persistent DataObject is added to the form using setDataObject() then this method will:

  • load the persistent object record from the database
  • copy the form's field values to the objects properties
  • update the object record in the database

Returns:
true if the DataObject was saved or false otherwise

onProcess

public boolean onProcess()
This method applies the object meta data to the form fields and then invokes the super.onProcess() method.

See Also:
Form.onProcess()

toString

public String toString()
This method applies the object meta data to the form fields and then invokes the super.toString() method.

See Also:
Form.toString()

applyMetaData

protected void applyMetaData()
Applies the DataObject validation database meta data to the form fields.

The field validation attributes include:

  • required - is a mandatory field and cannot be null
  • maxLength - the maximum length of the field

copyRelationFrom

protected void copyRelationFrom(DataObject dataObject)
Copy the relationships from the give data object to the form. The standard Form copyFrom() method cannot handle RelationSelect Fields.

Parameters:
dataObject - to copy relationships from

copyRelationsTo

protected void copyRelationsTo(DataObject dataObject)
                        throws Exception
Copy the relationships from the form to the given give data object. The standard Form copyTo() method cannot handle RelationSelect Fields.

Parameters:
dataObject - to copy relationships to
Throws:
Exception

log

Log the given message to the System out console if debug is enabled.

Parameters:
